newsArray.title: La revolución digital en el deporte: cómo las redes sociales impulsan el éxito
creator: El Periódico USA
newsArray.description: Actualmente, el mantenimiento de las asociaciones deportivas no depende sólo de su afiliación al gobierno sino a las estrategias de visibilidad en ellas NotiPress.- Actualmente, el deporte está viviendo una revolución en todo sentido, las formas de entrenar, la manera de competir e incluso la manera de generar ingresos ha ido cambiando. La digitalización de […]
newsArray.content: Monetizar la participación de las asociaciones deportivas es imprescindible para el apoyo del deporte. Actualmente, el mantenimiento de las asociaciones deportivas no depende sólo de su afiliación al gobierno sino a las estrategias de visibilidad en ellas NotiPress.- Actualmente, el deporte está viviendo una revolución en todo sentido, las formas de entrenar, la manera de competir e incluso la manera de generar ingresos ha ido cambiando. La digitalización de la vida cotidiana ha sido un cambio implacable, el cual exige actualizarse en el ámbito tecnológico y de redes sociales en el mundo de los deportes . Hoy en día, la sostenibilidad de los deportes depende de su presencia en redes sociales y la actualización de los medios para hacer presentes a los deportes en general. Según datos de Statista, las personas pasan un promedio diario de 151 minutos del día en redes sociales, lo cual hace que la presencia de los deportes en redes sea importante para su éxito. De acuerdo con datos de la CIES Football Observatory , organismo especializado en estadísticas de futbol, el Real Madrid es el más popular en redes sociales con 363 millones de seguidores . En el caso de futbol americano, los Dallas Cowboys y los New England Patriots se postulan como los clubes más populares entre los fanáticos de la NFL. Si bien estos clubes fueron consolidándose con el pasar del tiempo, el público, patrocinadores y los medios de comunicación tradicionales, hoy las redes sociales son el apoyo principal . Para los grandes clubes deportivos, las redes solo afianzan el éxito ya obtenido, pero para clubes y asociaciones deportivas más pequeñas representan una oportunidad de éxito deportivo . YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok y Twitter son solo algunas de las plataformas que funcionan como un altavoz para asociaciones y clubes emergentes en todo ámbito. Si bien es cierto que las redes pueden ser utilizadas para dar a conocer la asociación o club de deportes, el marketing deportivo es otra de las ramas en la cual las redes sociales también tienen injerencia. Primeramente, la accesibilidad de crear contenido para consumo en redes facilita la visibilidad a los usuarios, además el uso de palabras clave ayuda a visibilizar un contenido. Esto ayuda a posicionar el contenido dentro del nicho deportivo del que se esté hablando, haciendo más fácil la tarea de ser vistos no solo por el público, sino también por empresas. Esta visibilidad da la oportunidad de poder ser utilizada también como una ventana para la publicidad de cualquier empresa interesada en apoyar al deportista o asociación. Sin embargo, este apoyo dependerá enteramente de las políticas de la empresa en cuestión y de la capacidad administrativa con la que se cuente por parte de la asociación deportiva. Sumado a todo lo anterior, la actualización constante es imperativa para mantenerse dentro de los gustos de la población, generado interés y expectativa por parte del público. Quizá el punto más importante dentro del éxito deportivo para los clubes y asociaciones emergentes es la facilidad de interacción con el público en cualquiera de las plataformas. Pese a todo ello, las asociaciones deportivas pequeñas aun tienen que superar uno de los obstáculos más grandes y es el de convencer al público en general. Teniendo esto como punto de partida, el resto de las actividades podría parecer mas sencillo de cumplir, siempre y cuando, la solvencia e los clubes pueda permitir la permanencia de estos.

newsArray.title: CEO Jan-Christian Dreesen comments on Bayern Munich’s economic situation
creator: CCyler
newsArray.content: Recently, an investor plan was proposed and voted upon by clubs in the DFL system (namely the clubs that play in the Bundesliga and 2. Bundesliga), one which would massively benefit a lot of teams economically but would result in the German football brand leaning towards commercialisation as a large stake of all German football media would be sold to private investors. The proposal was ultimately rejected, but multiple prominent clubs such as Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich did vote in favour of it. Bayern Munich’s new CEO Jan-Christian Dreesen was asked how Bayern would be affected by this denial and if further shares of the club would be sold, and had the following to say: “We have three strategic partners, Audi, Allianz and Adidas, each with 8.33%. In theory, we still have 5% to sell. But that’s not a topic at the moment,” said Dreesen (as captured by @iMiaSanMia ). He was then asked if he sees Bayern’s position as precarious in relation to the spending they may have to incur in the transfer market to stay competitive, to which he said, “We are in a very solid position economically, we feel strong enough for the challenges of the transfer market. Nevertheless, we have to see how and where we can generate sources of revenue for FC Bayern independently of the DFL’s marketing,” Dreesen remarked. Following on, Dreesen would comment on Bayern’s dominating stature in the German game and how it affects the brand of German football as a whole: “When FC Bayern is doing well, the Bundesliga is doing well too, because it also benefits from our marketing success. Our sporting success over the last ten, fifteen years contributes to our leadership as a representative of German football... ...If we actively represent our points of view in the committees, then we automatically represent the interests of the Bundesliga, for example at the ECA (European Club Association) on the subject of financial fair play. We want to take on this responsibility again – not arrogantly, but confidently,” said Dreesen. It is clear that Bayern will have to spend bigger than ever this summer if they want to retain their spot amongst Europe’s elite, and while the recent falling through of the DFL investor plan was a major hit, it seems the club is still ready to tackle the market. Related Jan-Christian Dreesen says Bayern Munich bosses meeting regularly to discuss transfer targets

newsArray.title: MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concludes
creator: OUR STAFF REPORT
newsArray.description: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday.
newsArray.content: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday. Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub, a FIFA Regional Development Officer from Malaysia, dedicated five days to sharing his expertise with a group of 16 ex-FIFA and national referees from Pakistan. The course is a part of FIFA’s ‘Teach the Teachers program.’ By engaging in theoretical discussions and hands-on activities, he facilitated a comprehensive learning experience for the referees. After distributing the certificates among the participants during the closing ceremony, Chairman NC Haroon Malik said: “I would like to thank Mr. Rodzali who came here to teach referees new things according to FIFA and AFC standards. He extended his best wishes to all the participants who not only acquired new knowledge but would also pass it on and officiate in future matches and reinforced the commitment to improving the refereeing landscape in Pakistan.” On the occasion, Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub expressed his gratitude to the PFF for having him in Pakistan and to Khurram Shahzad, who is the referee manager for arranging the informative course for the referees. He expressed his satisfaction in sharing his experiences with the participants and hope that the standard of refereeing would improve. He acknowledged the participants’ potential to acquire new knowledge and highlighted their remarkable dedication to approaching the course’s practical and theoretical components. He commended their outstanding commitment and enthusiasm throughout the course.

newsArray.title: Damien Hardwick in stunning coaching backflip: ‘I miss it’
creator: Cameron Noakes
newsArray.description: Only weeks after he quit Richmond, the AFL mastermind has revealed the itch is already back.
newsArray.content: Only weeks after stunning the world with a shock resignation notice, Damien Hardwick has now confirmed he wants to coach again. The triple premiership mastermind surprised everyone last month when he told his beloved that his time was up, effective immediately. Analysis, local footy and the biggest moments, Seven and 7plus are the home of footy shows for every fan. Stream them all for free on Since then he has been to the US and he’s about to set off to Europe, but his passion for the game has always been on show. watching Richmond play GWS and he was at the ground when Trent Cotchin played his 300th game. Now Hardwick says wants to step back in, after revealing the last few weeks had been “challenging” without football in his life. “The one thing that footy does is really (get you in a ) routine ..., and all of a sudden you take that away and it’s amazing how quickly (you miss it). You enjoy the first couple of days but then it’s like, ‘Oh, what am I going to do now?’,” he told former footballer Dylan Buckley on the Dyl and Friends podcast. “I had a couple of days (when) I sort of decompressed and relaxed and then I said, ‘OK, I’m not very good at this’ .... Footy was such a big part of my life and it sort of defined me. “It’s been a little bit challenging learning how to relax, umm, and I think it’s something I’ve become better at, but also I need to find out what my next purpose is about moving forward and getting my teeth to stuck into something, otherwise I will drive myself insane.” Buckley then asked Hardwick about coaching and if he would return. “I will get f****** murdered by the whole community if I don’t ask you this. Coaching? Football? Where does it sit with you at the moment? Where’s your head at? ... Can you see yourself coaching it at another club?” he asked. Hardwick replied: “I’d be lying if I said I couldn’t see myself doing it. I love it. I miss it. I’ve been out for two weeks and I wanted to miss it. “I need a bit of time but I just love the game ... Like everyone, I’ve known it for a long time. “At some stage I will probably step back in, when that is, I’m not too sure.” Hardwick said he thought the time was right to leave Richmond with club being in a good spot and some fresh faces on the playing list. He said his parents were the first people he spoke to about his decision to quit the Tigers, and they cried when he told them the news. “They were just happy that I go out at a time that felt right ... I wanted to go out feeling great about what I had achieved,” he said. One thing is certain, Hardwick won’t be taking up golf anytime soon. “I made the fatal mistake of trying to get back into golf which, umm ... sounded like a good idea at time ... (then) there was realisation that I’m not too good at this.” Hardwick is an AFL coaching great, with three flags to his name in 2017, 2019 and 2020. He is Richmond’s longest-serving coach and sits 22nd for the most AFL/VFL games coached in competition history.

newsArray.title: 'Shrewd business': Commentator backs West Ham or Everton to sign 'real talent' from PL club
creator: Amir Mir
newsArray.description: Ian Darke has backed either David Moyes’ West Ham United or Sean Dyche’s Everton to sign Christian Pulisic from Chelsea this summer. The popular football... The post 'Shrewd business': Commentator backs West Ham or Everton to sign 'real talent' from PL club appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: The popular football commentator added that is ‘not wanted by ‘ and he needs to find a new home in order to pick up his stumbling career. and names were thrown into the transfer hat, with Darke adding that it would be ‘shrewd business’ if any of those teams signed him up, as he told . The 24-year-old has had a mountain of problems at Stamford Bridge over the years from injury issues, lack of form, game time or just struggling to get going under most of the managers he has had. With Chelsea clearing out their squad, then you would expect Pulisic to be one of the names to leave, but where will he go? . But, for Darke, it’s better off Pulisic goes lower down the table and perhaps to West Ham, who will be in the Europa League next season, or Everton, who once again, narrowly avoided relegation. “Yes (on Pulisic needing to move to a team lower down the PL table) and he needs minutes, he needs to play,” said Darke. “He has missed so many games, for one reason or another over the last three years, not always his fault. He has been unlucky with injuries. “And also, he hasn’t been given a proper run in the team when he has been fit, either. It hasn’t worked out for Chelsea, you heard what he just said. You want to be somewhere that you are wanted and comfortable. “Well, he isn’t wanted at Chelsea and he obviously isn’t comfortable at Chelsea, so some kind of move. You mention Milan, well they have had Rafael Leao playing in his position, so if he went, then Pulisic could be quite a good replacement. “He could be a bit of shrewd business for the kind of teams mentioned there (Everton and West Ham). If he’s fit, they get him up to speed and his confidence is there as well, then you will start to see a much better player. He has real talent, but we just haven’t seen it for the last two or three seasons.” Pulisic better suited to West Ham than Everton The issue facing Everton here is that they are still a mess, both on and off the field, so you have to question what direction they are actually going. Can they even afford Pulisic? It wouldn’t be a surprise if that’s a no, which would then open the door for someone like West Ham to add him to their attacking ranks. Yes, they are Europa Conference League champions, but their forward line needs prepping up again and someone like Pulisic could work well in East London.

newsArray.title: Brozovića svi sele u Al Nassr, on "ništa ne zna o tome"
newsArray.description: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića.
newsArray.content: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića. Mediji: Brozović odlazi u Saudijsku Arabiju City sprema ludu ponudu za Joška Gvardiola Romano tvrdi kako delegacija saudijskog Al Nassra u ponedjeljak dolazi u Milano kompletirati dogovor i s Interom i s hrvatskim reprezentativcem. Milanski klub će navodno dobiti odštetu od oko 25 milijuna eura, dok bi Brozović potpisao trogodišnji ugovor po kojem će zarađivati oko 20 milijuna eura godišnje. No Brozović je u razgovoru s talijanskim novinarom rekao kako o svemu ništa ne zna. - Svi se opraštaju od mene, a ja nisam ni s kim razgovarao. Ovo je ludost, rekao je Fabriziju Biasinu . "Broza" na dolazak nagovara i Barcelona, koja je navodno poslala ponudu, no dosta manju od Al Nassrove. All the reports seem to point towards Marcelo Brozovic joining Al-Nassr, but the Inter midfielder is dropping no hints. ‘Everyone is saying goodbye to me… This is mad.’ https://t.co/WqKr0HImwb #FCIM #AlNassr #FCBarcelona #Brozovic — Football Italia (@footballitalia) June 25, 2023 googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657620534770-0'); }); googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657619086178-0'); }); prije 2 h Velika pobjeda Kneževića, Milun izgubio prekidom prije 2 h Blinken: Pobuna Wagnerovaca otkrila ozbiljne pukotine u vodstvu Putina prije 2 h Košarkašice Belgije preokretom do europskog naslova _ipromNS('zone',32) _ipromNS('zone',265)

newsArray.title: Liverpool's fastest player revealed as Kyle Walker tops Premier League charts
newsArray.description: Data published from the Premier League puts Darwin Nunez as the fifth fastest player in the division
newsArray.content: Manchester City star Kyle Walker once again clocked-up the top speed in the Premier League last season. Walker, 33, has been renowned throughout his career as a jet-heeled defender for club and country - and he even managed to keep Kylian Mbappe at bay during their World Cup showdown. The England international's fastest sprint during the 2022/2023 campaign came in at a rather astonishing 37.31 km/h. Nottingham Forest striker Brennan Johnson (36.70 km/h) and Chelsea prospect Mykailo Mudryk (36.63 km/h) were second and third respectively, while former Everton forward Anthony Gordon (36.61 km/h) and frontman (36.53 km/h) completed the top-five places. It means Nunez is officially the quickest player in Liverpool right now! Data from the was uploaded on their Twitter account this afternoon. Other high-profile names in the top-10 include Manchester City goal machine Erling Haaland and mid-season Tottenham Hotspur loanee Arnaut Danjuma, who peaked at 36.22 km/h and 36.34 km/h respectively. In his debut campaign, Nunez proved to be quicker than renowned speedsters Harvey Barnes (Leicester City) and Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). Having arrived at Liverpool from Benfica last summer, Nunez recorded nine goals - and three assists - during his first Premier League season from 29 appearances. He scored six more in other competitions. The 24-year-old cost around €80m and has already been capped 16 times by the Uruguay national team. He has also netted three goals for his country and represented them at the winter World Cup finals in Qatar. at Anfield next season.

newsArray.title: Мілан зацікавився півзахисником Бенфіки
newsArray.description: Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа.Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо.Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із п...
newsArray.content: #Мілан Джерело - football.ua . Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа. Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо. Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із представниками Флорентіну. Навесні минулого року Флорентіно продовжив контракт з Бенфікою. При цьому, "орли" забезпечили собі непоганий заробіток, якщо хтось із грандів світового футболу забажає отримати собі цього футболіста — клаусула в разі чого складе 120 млн євро. Португалець минулого сезону провів 44 матчі у всіх турнірах і зробив 3 гольові передачі. Нагадаємо Мілан продовжує спроби підписати Тюрама.

newsArray.title: Laut Ranking: Hansi Flick ist bestbezahlter Nationaltrainer der Welt
newsArray.description: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten.
newsArray.content: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten. Hansi Flick ist mit etwa 6,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr der bestbezahlte Nationaltrainer der Welt. Das geht aus einer Liste mit den geschätzten Gehältern aller WM-Trainer des Jahres 2022 des französischen Portals "France Football" hervor. Nach Flick auf Rang eins folgen unter anderem Englands Gareth Southgate mit 5,8 Millionen Euro auf Platz zwei und Frankreichs Didier Deschamps (3,8 Millionen Euro) auf Platz drei. Der argentinische Weltmeistertrainer Lionel Scaloni ist mit 2,9 Millionen Euro dicht dahinter. Trainer, die erst nach der WM einen Nationalposten übernahmen oder wie etwa Italiens Roberto Mancini gar nicht an dem Turnier teilgenommen hatten, verdienen ebenfalls weniger als Flick. Löw verdiente offenbar deutlich weniger Aber warum kassiert der deutsche Bundestrainer überhaupt so viel Geld? Das Gehalt von Vorgänger Joachim Löw wurde nach "Bild"-Informationen auf 3 bis 3,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr geschätzt. Da Flick aber zuvor beim FC Bayern coachte und mit seinem damaligen Team sechs Titel in einer Saison gewonnen hatte, war er wohl in einer guten Verhandlungsposition. Für ihn und sein Team gilt es nun, sich auf die Heim-Europameisterschaft im kommenden Jahr zu konzentrieren. Zuletzt konnte er nur vier von 16 Länderspielen gewinnen.

newsArray.title: Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed
creator: Peter Lynch
newsArray.description: Outgoing Everton defender has not agreed terms with Premier League rivals Fulham, according to Fabrizio Romano. The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per journalist Alan Nixon (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as ... The post Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as confirmed by the (9 June). “Understand Yerry Mina has not agreed terms with Fulham despite reports – nothing done, race remains open for the centre-back as free agent,” Romano wrote on . “Told Besiktas made an official proposal; Lens, Granada and Bologna are also interested.” Mina is clearly well-liked by various clubs, with a battle for his services seemingly on the cards this summer. He played a key role in keeping Everton in the top flight last season, despite only really coming into the picture at the very end of the campaign under Sean Dyche. Mina does have a questionable injury record, but the Toffees have already lost Conor Coady since the end of the season, with the centre-back returning to parent club Wolves. Youngster Jarrad Branthwaite could play a central part under the manager next time out following his loan spell at PSV, but Dyche will definitely be delving into the transfer market in order to bolster his options at the back. Mina’s exit seemed very likely for quite some time, but not many people would have been predicting the 28-year-old to stay in England. He may have the chance to do just that at Fulham, but it remains to be seen where he will be playing his football in the upcoming campaign.

creator: CCyler
newsArray.content: Recently, an investor plan was proposed and voted upon by clubs in the DFL system (namely the clubs that play in the Bundesliga and 2. Bundesliga), one which would massively benefit a lot of teams economically but would result in the German football brand leaning towards commercialisation as a large stake of all German football media would be sold to private investors. Following on, Dreesen would comment on Bayern’s dominating stature in the German game and how it affects the brand of German football as a whole: “When FC Bayern is doing well, the Bundesliga is doing well too, because it also benefits from our marketing success. Our sporting success over the last ten, fifteen years contributes to our leadership as a representative of German football... ...If we actively represent our points of view in the committees, then we automatically represent the interests of the Bundesliga, for example at the ECA (European Club Association) on the subject of financial fair play. newsArray.title: MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concludes
creator: OUR STAFF REPORT
newsArray.description: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday.
newsArray.content: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday. Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub, a FIFA Regional Development Officer from Malaysia, dedicated five days to sharing his expertise with a group of 16 ex-FIFA and national referees from Pakistan. The course is a part of FIFA’s ‘Teach the Teachers program.’ By engaging in theoretical discussions and hands-on activities, he facilitated a comprehensive learning experience for the referees. After distributing the certificates among the participants during the closing ceremony, Chairman NC Haroon Malik said: “I would like to thank Mr. Rodzali who came here to teach referees new things according to FIFA and AFC standards. He extended his best wishes to all the participants who not only acquired new knowledge but would also pass it on and officiate in future matches and reinforced the commitment to improving the refereeing landscape in Pakistan.” On the occasion, Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub expressed his gratitude to the PFF for having him in Pakistan and to Khurram Shahzad, who is the referee manager for arranging the informative course for the referees. He expressed his satisfaction in sharing his experiences with the participants and hope that the standard of refereeing would improve. He acknowledged the participants’ potential to acquire new knowledge and highlighted their remarkable dedication to approaching the course’s practical and theoretical components. He commended their outstanding commitment and enthusiasm throughout the course.

newsArray.title: Damien Hardwick in stunning coaching backflip: ‘I miss it’
creator: Cameron Noakes
newsArray.description: Only weeks after he quit Richmond, the AFL mastermind has revealed the itch is already back.
newsArray.content: Only weeks after stunning the world with a shock resignation notice, Damien Hardwick has now confirmed he wants to coach again. The triple premiership mastermind surprised everyone last month when he told his beloved that his time was up, effective immediately. Analysis, local footy and the biggest moments, Seven and 7plus are the home of footy shows for every fan. Stream them all for free on Since then he has been to the US and he’s about to set off to Europe, but his passion for the game has always been on show. watching Richmond play GWS and he was at the ground when Trent Cotchin played his 300th game. Now Hardwick says wants to step back in, after revealing the last few weeks had been “challenging” without football in his life. “The one thing that footy does is really (get you in a ) routine ..., and all of a sudden you take that away and it’s amazing how quickly (you miss it). You enjoy the first couple of days but then it’s like, ‘Oh, what am I going to do now?’,” he told former footballer Dylan Buckley on the Dyl and Friends podcast. “I had a couple of days (when) I sort of decompressed and relaxed and then I said, ‘OK, I’m not very good at this’ .... Footy was such a big part of my life and it sort of defined me. “It’s been a little bit challenging learning how to relax, umm, and I think it’s something I’ve become better at, but also I need to find out what my next purpose is about moving forward and getting my teeth to stuck into something, otherwise I will drive myself insane.” Buckley then asked Hardwick about coaching and if he would return. “I will get f****** murdered by the whole community if I don’t ask you this. Coaching? Football? Where does it sit with you at the moment? Where’s your head at? ... Can you see yourself coaching it at another club?” he asked. Hardwick replied: “I’d be lying if I said I couldn’t see myself doing it. I love it. I miss it. I’ve been out for two weeks and I wanted to miss it. “I need a bit of time but I just love the game ... Like everyone, I’ve known it for a long time. “At some stage I will probably step back in, when that is, I’m not too sure.” Hardwick said he thought the time was right to leave Richmond with club being in a good spot and some fresh faces on the playing list. He said his parents were the first people he spoke to about his decision to quit the Tigers, and they cried when he told them the news. “They were just happy that I go out at a time that felt right ... I wanted to go out feeling great about what I had achieved,” he said. One thing is certain, Hardwick won’t be taking up golf anytime soon. “I made the fatal mistake of trying to get back into golf which, umm ... sounded like a good idea at time ... (then) there was realisation that I’m not too good at this.” Hardwick is an AFL coaching great, with three flags to his name in 2017, 2019 and 2020. He is Richmond’s longest-serving coach and sits 22nd for the most AFL/VFL games coached in competition history.

newsArray.title: 'Shrewd business': Commentator backs West Ham or Everton to sign 'real talent' from PL club
creator: Amir Mir
newsArray.description: Ian Darke has backed either David Moyes’ West Ham United or Sean Dyche’s Everton to sign Christian Pulisic from Chelsea this summer. The popular football... The post 'Shrewd business': Commentator backs West Ham or Everton to sign 'real talent' from PL club appeared first on HITC.
newsArray.content: The popular football commentator added that is ‘not wanted by ‘ and he needs to find a new home in order to pick up his stumbling career. and names were thrown into the transfer hat, with Darke adding that it would be ‘shrewd business’ if any of those teams signed him up, as he told . The 24-year-old has had a mountain of problems at Stamford Bridge over the years from injury issues, lack of form, game time or just struggling to get going under most of the managers he has had. With Chelsea clearing out their squad, then you would expect Pulisic to be one of the names to leave, but where will he go? . But, for Darke, it’s better off Pulisic goes lower down the table and perhaps to West Ham, who will be in the Europa League next season, or Everton, who once again, narrowly avoided relegation. “Yes (on Pulisic needing to move to a team lower down the PL table) and he needs minutes, he needs to play,” said Darke. “He has missed so many games, for one reason or another over the last three years, not always his fault. He has been unlucky with injuries. “And also, he hasn’t been given a proper run in the team when he has been fit, either. It hasn’t worked out for Chelsea, you heard what he just said. You want to be somewhere that you are wanted and comfortable. “Well, he isn’t wanted at Chelsea and he obviously isn’t comfortable at Chelsea, so some kind of move. You mention Milan, well they have had Rafael Leao playing in his position, so if he went, then Pulisic could be quite a good replacement. “He could be a bit of shrewd business for the kind of teams mentioned there (Everton and West Ham). If he’s fit, they get him up to speed and his confidence is there as well, then you will start to see a much better player. He has real talent, but we just haven’t seen it for the last two or three seasons.” Pulisic better suited to West Ham than Everton The issue facing Everton here is that they are still a mess, both on and off the field, so you have to question what direction they are actually going. Can they even afford Pulisic? It wouldn’t be a surprise if that’s a no, which would then open the door for someone like West Ham to add him to their attacking ranks. Yes, they are Europa Conference League champions, but their forward line needs prepping up again and someone like Pulisic could work well in East London.

newsArray.title: Brozovića svi sele u Al Nassr, on "ništa ne zna o tome"
newsArray.description: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića.
newsArray.content: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića. Mediji: Brozović odlazi u Saudijsku Arabiju City sprema ludu ponudu za Joška Gvardiola Romano tvrdi kako delegacija saudijskog Al Nassra u ponedjeljak dolazi u Milano kompletirati dogovor i s Interom i s hrvatskim reprezentativcem. Milanski klub će navodno dobiti odštetu od oko 25 milijuna eura, dok bi Brozović potpisao trogodišnji ugovor po kojem će zarađivati oko 20 milijuna eura godišnje. No Brozović je u razgovoru s talijanskim novinarom rekao kako o svemu ništa ne zna. - Svi se opraštaju od mene, a ja nisam ni s kim razgovarao. Ovo je ludost, rekao je Fabriziju Biasinu . "Broza" na dolazak nagovara i Barcelona, koja je navodno poslala ponudu, no dosta manju od Al Nassrove. All the reports seem to point towards Marcelo Brozovic joining Al-Nassr, but the Inter midfielder is dropping no hints. ‘Everyone is saying goodbye to me… This is mad.’ https://t.co/WqKr0HImwb #FCIM #AlNassr #FCBarcelona #Brozovic — Football Italia (@footballitalia) June 25, 2023 googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657620534770-0'); }); googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657619086178-0'); }); prije 2 h Velika pobjeda Kneževića, Milun izgubio prekidom prije 2 h Blinken: Pobuna Wagnerovaca otkrila ozbiljne pukotine u vodstvu Putina prije 2 h Košarkašice Belgije preokretom do europskog naslova _ipromNS('zone',32) _ipromNS('zone',265)

newsArray.title: Liverpool's fastest player revealed as Kyle Walker tops Premier League charts
newsArray.description: Data published from the Premier League puts Darwin Nunez as the fifth fastest player in the division
newsArray.content: Manchester City star Kyle Walker once again clocked-up the top speed in the Premier League last season. Walker, 33, has been renowned throughout his career as a jet-heeled defender for club and country - and he even managed to keep Kylian Mbappe at bay during their World Cup showdown. The England international's fastest sprint during the 2022/2023 campaign came in at a rather astonishing 37.31 km/h. Nottingham Forest striker Brennan Johnson (36.70 km/h) and Chelsea prospect Mykailo Mudryk (36.63 km/h) were second and third respectively, while former Everton forward Anthony Gordon (36.61 km/h) and frontman (36.53 km/h) completed the top-five places. It means Nunez is officially the quickest player in Liverpool right now! Data from the was uploaded on their Twitter account this afternoon. Other high-profile names in the top-10 include Manchester City goal machine Erling Haaland and mid-season Tottenham Hotspur loanee Arnaut Danjuma, who peaked at 36.22 km/h and 36.34 km/h respectively. In his debut campaign, Nunez proved to be quicker than renowned speedsters Harvey Barnes (Leicester City) and Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). Having arrived at Liverpool from Benfica last summer, Nunez recorded nine goals - and three assists - during his first Premier League season from 29 appearances. He scored six more in other competitions. The 24-year-old cost around €80m and has already been capped 16 times by the Uruguay national team. He has also netted three goals for his country and represented them at the winter World Cup finals in Qatar. at Anfield next season.

newsArray.title: Мілан зацікавився півзахисником Бенфіки
newsArray.description: Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа.Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо.Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із п...
newsArray.content: #Мілан Джерело - football.ua . Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа. Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо. Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із представниками Флорентіну. Навесні минулого року Флорентіно продовжив контракт з Бенфікою. При цьому, "орли" забезпечили собі непоганий заробіток, якщо хтось із грандів світового футболу забажає отримати собі цього футболіста — клаусула в разі чого складе 120 млн євро. Португалець минулого сезону провів 44 матчі у всіх турнірах і зробив 3 гольові передачі. Нагадаємо Мілан продовжує спроби підписати Тюрама.

newsArray.title: Laut Ranking: Hansi Flick ist bestbezahlter Nationaltrainer der Welt
newsArray.description: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten.
newsArray.content: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten. Hansi Flick ist mit etwa 6,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr der bestbezahlte Nationaltrainer der Welt. Das geht aus einer Liste mit den geschätzten Gehältern aller WM-Trainer des Jahres 2022 des französischen Portals "France Football" hervor. Nach Flick auf Rang eins folgen unter anderem Englands Gareth Southgate mit 5,8 Millionen Euro auf Platz zwei und Frankreichs Didier Deschamps (3,8 Millionen Euro) auf Platz drei. Der argentinische Weltmeistertrainer Lionel Scaloni ist mit 2,9 Millionen Euro dicht dahinter. Trainer, die erst nach der WM einen Nationalposten übernahmen oder wie etwa Italiens Roberto Mancini gar nicht an dem Turnier teilgenommen hatten, verdienen ebenfalls weniger als Flick. Löw verdiente offenbar deutlich weniger Aber warum kassiert der deutsche Bundestrainer überhaupt so viel Geld? Das Gehalt von Vorgänger Joachim Löw wurde nach "Bild"-Informationen auf 3 bis 3,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr geschätzt. Da Flick aber zuvor beim FC Bayern coachte und mit seinem damaligen Team sechs Titel in einer Saison gewonnen hatte, war er wohl in einer guten Verhandlungsposition. Für ihn und sein Team gilt es nun, sich auf die Heim-Europameisterschaft im kommenden Jahr zu konzentrieren. Zuletzt konnte er nur vier von 16 Länderspielen gewinnen.

newsArray.title: Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed
creator: Peter Lynch
newsArray.description: Outgoing Everton defender has not agreed terms with Premier League rivals Fulham, according to Fabrizio Romano. The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per journalist Alan Nixon (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as ... The post Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as confirmed by the (9 June). “Understand Yerry Mina has not agreed terms with Fulham despite reports – nothing done, race remains open for the centre-back as free agent,” Romano wrote on . “Told Besiktas made an official proposal; Lens, Granada and Bologna are also interested.” Mina is clearly well-liked by various clubs, with a battle for his services seemingly on the cards this summer. He played a key role in keeping Everton in the top flight last season, despite only really coming into the picture at the very end of the campaign under Sean Dyche. Mina does have a questionable injury record, but the Toffees have already lost Conor Coady since the end of the season, with the centre-back returning to parent club Wolves. Youngster Jarrad Branthwaite could play a central part under the manager next time out following his loan spell at PSV, but Dyche will definitely be delving into the transfer market in order to bolster his options at the back. Mina’s exit seemed very likely for quite some time, but not many people would have been predicting the 28-year-old to stay in England. He may have the chance to do just that at Fulham, but it remains to be seen where he will be playing his football in the upcoming campaign.

newsArray.title: La revolución digital en el deporte: cómo las redes sociales impulsan el éxito
creator: El Periódico USA
newsArray.description: Actualmente, el mantenimiento de las asociaciones deportivas no depende sólo de su afiliación al gobierno sino a las estrategias de visibilidad en ellas NotiPress.- Actualmente, el deporte está viviendo una revolución en todo sentido, las formas de entrenar, la manera de competir e incluso la manera de generar ingresos ha ido cambiando. La digitalización de […]
newsArray.content: Monetizar la participación de las asociaciones deportivas es imprescindible para el apoyo del deporte. Actualmente, el mantenimiento de las asociaciones deportivas no depende sólo de su afiliación al gobierno sino a las estrategias de visibilidad en ellas NotiPress.- Actualmente, el deporte está viviendo una revolución en todo sentido, las formas de entrenar, la manera de competir e incluso la manera de generar ingresos ha ido cambiando. La digitalización de la vida cotidiana ha sido un cambio implacable, el cual exige actualizarse en el ámbito tecnológico y de redes sociales en el mundo de los deportes . Hoy en día, la sostenibilidad de los deportes depende de su presencia en redes sociales y la actualización de los medios para hacer presentes a los deportes en general. Según datos de Statista, las personas pasan un promedio diario de 151 minutos del día en redes sociales, lo cual hace que la presencia de los deportes en redes sea importante para su éxito. De acuerdo con datos de la CIES Football Observatory , organismo especializado en estadísticas de futbol, el Real Madrid es el más popular en redes sociales con 363 millones de seguidores . En el caso de futbol americano, los Dallas Cowboys y los New England Patriots se postulan como los clubes más populares entre los fanáticos de la NFL. Si bien estos clubes fueron consolidándose con el pasar del tiempo, el público, patrocinadores y los medios de comunicación tradicionales, hoy las redes sociales son el apoyo principal . Para los grandes clubes deportivos, las redes solo afianzan el éxito ya obtenido, pero para clubes y asociaciones deportivas más pequeñas representan una oportunidad de éxito deportivo . YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok y Twitter son solo algunas de las plataformas que funcionan como un altavoz para asociaciones y clubes emergentes en todo ámbito. Si bien es cierto que las redes pueden ser utilizadas para dar a conocer la asociación o club de deportes, el marketing deportivo es otra de las ramas en la cual las redes sociales también tienen injerencia. Primeramente, la accesibilidad de crear contenido para consumo en redes facilita la visibilidad a los usuarios, además el uso de palabras clave ayuda a visibilizar un contenido. Esto ayuda a posicionar el contenido dentro del nicho deportivo del que se esté hablando, haciendo más fácil la tarea de ser vistos no solo por el público, sino también por empresas. Esta visibilidad da la oportunidad de poder ser utilizada también como una ventana para la publicidad de cualquier empresa interesada en apoyar al deportista o asociación. Sin embargo, este apoyo dependerá enteramente de las políticas de la empresa en cuestión y de la capacidad administrativa con la que se cuente por parte de la asociación deportiva. Sumado a todo lo anterior, la actualización constante es imperativa para mantenerse dentro de los gustos de la población, generado interés y expectativa por parte del público. Quizá el punto más importante dentro del éxito deportivo para los clubes y asociaciones emergentes es la facilidad de interacción con el público en cualquiera de las plataformas. Pese a todo ello, las asociaciones deportivas pequeñas aun tienen que superar uno de los obstáculos más grandes y es el de convencer al público en general. Teniendo esto como punto de partida, el resto de las actividades podría parecer mas sencillo de cumplir, siempre y cuando, la solvencia e los clubes pueda permitir la permanencia de estos.

newsArray.title: CEO Jan-Christian Dreesen comments on Bayern Munich’s economic situation
creator: CCyler
newsArray.content: Recently, an investor plan was proposed and voted upon by clubs in the DFL system (namely the clubs that play in the Bundesliga and 2. Bundesliga), one which would massively benefit a lot of teams economically but would result in the German football brand leaning towards commercialisation as a large stake of all German football media would be sold to private investors. The proposal was ultimately rejected, but multiple prominent clubs such as Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich did vote in favour of it. Bayern Munich’s new CEO Jan-Christian Dreesen was asked how Bayern would be affected by this denial and if further shares of the club would be sold, and had the following to say: “We have three strategic partners, Audi, Allianz and Adidas, each with 8.33%. In theory, we still have 5% to sell. But that’s not a topic at the moment,” said Dreesen (as captured by @iMiaSanMia ). He was then asked if he sees Bayern’s position as precarious in relation to the spending they may have to incur in the transfer market to stay competitive, to which he said, “We are in a very solid position economically, we feel strong enough for the challenges of the transfer market. Nevertheless, we have to see how and where we can generate sources of revenue for FC Bayern independently of the DFL’s marketing,” Dreesen remarked. Following on, Dreesen would comment on Bayern’s dominating stature in the German game and how it affects the brand of German football as a whole: “When FC Bayern is doing well, the Bundesliga is doing well too, because it also benefits from our marketing success. Our sporting success over the last ten, fifteen years contributes to our leadership as a representative of German football... ...If we actively represent our points of view in the committees, then we automatically represent the interests of the Bundesliga, for example at the ECA (European Club Association) on the subject of financial fair play. We want to take on this responsibility again – not arrogantly, but confidently,” said Dreesen. It is clear that Bayern will have to spend bigger than ever this summer if they want to retain their spot amongst Europe’s elite, and while the recent falling through of the DFL investor plan was a major hit, it seems the club is still ready to tackle the market. Related Jan-Christian Dreesen says Bayern Munich bosses meeting regularly to discuss transfer targets

creator: OUR STAFF REPORT
newsArray.description: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday.
newsArray.content: LAHORE-The first MA Referee Instructor Course 2023 concluded under the supervision of Course Instructor Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub here at the Football House on Sunday. Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub, a FIFA Regional Development Officer from Malaysia, dedicated five days to sharing his expertise with a group of 16 ex-FIFA and national referees from Pakistan. The course is a part of FIFA’s ‘Teach the Teachers program.’ By engaging in theoretical discussions and hands-on activities, he facilitated a comprehensive learning experience for the referees. After distributing the certificates among the participants during the closing ceremony, Chairman NC Haroon Malik said: “I would like to thank Mr. Rodzali who came here to teach referees new things according to FIFA and AFC standards. He extended his best wishes to all the participants who not only acquired new knowledge but would also pass it on and officiate in future matches and reinforced the commitment to improving the refereeing landscape in Pakistan.” On the occasion, Mohamad Rodzali Yaqub expressed his gratitude to the PFF for having him in Pakistan and to Khurram Shahzad, who is the referee manager for arranging the informative course for the referees. He expressed his satisfaction in sharing his experiences with the participants and hope that the standard of refereeing would improve. He acknowledged the participants’ potential to acquire new knowledge and highlighted their remarkable dedication to approaching the course’s practical and theoretical components. He commended their outstanding commitment and enthusiasm throughout the course.

newsArray.title: Damien Hardwick in stunning coaching backflip: ‘I miss it’
creator: Cameron Noakes
newsArray.description: Only weeks after he quit Richmond, the AFL mastermind has revealed the itch is already back.
newsArray.content: Only weeks after stunning the world with a shock resignation notice, Damien Hardwick has now confirmed he wants to coach again. The triple premiership mastermind surprised everyone last month when he told his beloved that his time was up, effective immediately. Analysis, local footy and the biggest moments, Seven and 7plus are the home of footy shows for every fan. Stream them all for free on Since then he has been to the US and he’s about to set off to Europe, but his passion for the game has always been on show. watching Richmond play GWS and he was at the ground when Trent Cotchin played his 300th game. Now Hardwick says wants to step back in, after revealing the last few weeks had been “challenging” without football in his life. “The one thing that footy does is really (get you in a ) routine ..., and all of a sudden you take that away and it’s amazing how quickly (you miss it). You enjoy the first couple of days but then it’s like, ‘Oh, what am I going to do now?’,” he told former footballer Dylan Buckley on the Dyl and Friends podcast. “I had a couple of days (when) I sort of decompressed and relaxed and then I said, ‘OK, I’m not very good at this’ .... Footy was such a big part of my life and it sort of defined me. “It’s been a little bit challenging learning how to relax, umm, and I think it’s something I’ve become better at, but also I need to find out what my next purpose is about moving forward and getting my teeth to stuck into something, otherwise I will drive myself insane.” Buckley then asked Hardwick about coaching and if he would return. “I will get f****** murdered by the whole community if I don’t ask you this. Coaching? Football? Where does it sit with you at the moment? Where’s your head at? ... Can you see yourself coaching it at another club?” he asked. Hardwick replied: “I’d be lying if I said I couldn’t see myself doing it. I love it. I miss it. I’ve been out for two weeks and I wanted to miss it. “I need a bit of time but I just love the game ... Like everyone, I’ve known it for a long time. “At some stage I will probably step back in, when that is, I’m not too sure.” Hardwick said he thought the time was right to leave Richmond with club being in a good spot and some fresh faces on the playing list. He said his parents were the first people he spoke to about his decision to quit the Tigers, and they cried when he told them the news. “They were just happy that I go out at a time that felt right ... I wanted to go out feeling great about what I had achieved,” he said. One thing is certain, Hardwick won’t be taking up golf anytime soon. “I made the fatal mistake of trying to get back into golf which, umm ... sounded like a good idea at time ... (then) there was realisation that I’m not too good at this.” Hardwick is an AFL coaching great, with three flags to his name in 2017, 2019 and 2020. He is Richmond’s longest-serving coach and sits 22nd for the most AFL/VFL games coached in competition history.

You mention Milan, well they have had Rafael Leao playing in his position, so if he went, then Pulisic could be quite a good replacement. “He could be a bit of shrewd business for the kind of teams mentioned there (Everton and West Ham). If he’s fit, they get him up to speed and his confidence is there as well, then you will start to see a much better player. He has real talent, but we just haven’t seen it for the last two or three seasons.” Pulisic better suited to West Ham than Everton The issue facing Everton here is that they are still a mess, both on and off the field, so you have to question what direction they are actually going. Can they even afford Pulisic? It wouldn’t be a surprise if that’s a no, which would then open the door for someone like West Ham to add him to their attacking ranks. Yes, they are Europa Conference League champions, but their forward line needs prepping up again and someone like Pulisic could work well in East London.

newsArray.title: Brozovića svi sele u Al Nassr, on "ništa ne zna o tome"
newsArray.description: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića.
newsArray.content: Talijanski novinar Fabrizio Romano, dobar poznavatelj nogometnog tržišta, objavio je danas dodatne detalje o transferu Marcela Brozovića. Mediji: Brozović odlazi u Saudijsku Arabiju City sprema ludu ponudu za Joška Gvardiola Romano tvrdi kako delegacija saudijskog Al Nassra u ponedjeljak dolazi u Milano kompletirati dogovor i s Interom i s hrvatskim reprezentativcem. Milanski klub će navodno dobiti odštetu od oko 25 milijuna eura, dok bi Brozović potpisao trogodišnji ugovor po kojem će zarađivati oko 20 milijuna eura godišnje. No Brozović je u razgovoru s talijanskim novinarom rekao kako o svemu ništa ne zna. - Svi se opraštaju od mene, a ja nisam ni s kim razgovarao. Ovo je ludost, rekao je Fabriziju Biasinu . "Broza" na dolazak nagovara i Barcelona, koja je navodno poslala ponudu, no dosta manju od Al Nassrove. All the reports seem to point towards Marcelo Brozovic joining Al-Nassr, but the Inter midfielder is dropping no hints. ‘Everyone is saying goodbye to me… This is mad.’ https://t.co/WqKr0HImwb #FCIM #AlNassr #FCBarcelona #Brozovic — Football Italia (@footballitalia) June 25, 2023 googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657620534770-0'); }); googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1657619086178-0'); }); prije 2 h Velika pobjeda Kneževića, Milun izgubio prekidom prije 2 h Blinken: Pobuna Wagnerovaca otkrila ozbiljne pukotine u vodstvu Putina prije 2 h Košarkašice Belgije preokretom do europskog naslova _ipromNS('zone',32) _ipromNS('zone',265)

newsArray.title: Liverpool's fastest player revealed as Kyle Walker tops Premier League charts
newsArray.description: Data published from the Premier League puts Darwin Nunez as the fifth fastest player in the division
newsArray.content: Manchester City star Kyle Walker once again clocked-up the top speed in the Premier League last season. Walker, 33, has been renowned throughout his career as a jet-heeled defender for club and country - and he even managed to keep Kylian Mbappe at bay during their World Cup showdown. The England international's fastest sprint during the 2022/2023 campaign came in at a rather astonishing 37.31 km/h. Nottingham Forest striker Brennan Johnson (36.70 km/h) and Chelsea prospect Mykailo Mudryk (36.63 km/h) were second and third respectively, while former Everton forward Anthony Gordon (36.61 km/h) and frontman (36.53 km/h) completed the top-five places. It means Nunez is officially the quickest player in Liverpool right now! Data from the was uploaded on their Twitter account this afternoon. Other high-profile names in the top-10 include Manchester City goal machine Erling Haaland and mid-season Tottenham Hotspur loanee Arnaut Danjuma, who peaked at 36.22 km/h and 36.34 km/h respectively. In his debut campaign, Nunez proved to be quicker than renowned speedsters Harvey Barnes (Leicester City) and Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). Having arrived at Liverpool from Benfica last summer, Nunez recorded nine goals - and three assists - during his first Premier League season from 29 appearances. He scored six more in other competitions. The 24-year-old cost around €80m and has already been capped 16 times by the Uruguay national team. He has also netted three goals for his country and represented them at the winter World Cup finals in Qatar. at Anfield next season.

newsArray.title: Мілан зацікавився півзахисником Бенфіки
newsArray.description: Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа.Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо.Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із п...
newsArray.content: #Мілан Джерело - football.ua . Хавбек Бенфіки Флорентіну може змінити клубну прописку цього літа. Про це повідомляє Джанлука Ді Марціо. Футболіст може перейти в Мілан. Португальський клуб не проти продати футболіста, але хоче за нього 30 мільйонів євро. Міланці вже спілкувались із представниками Флорентіну. Навесні минулого року Флорентіно продовжив контракт з Бенфікою. При цьому, "орли" забезпечили собі непоганий заробіток, якщо хтось із грандів світового футболу забажає отримати собі цього футболіста — клаусула в разі чого складе 120 млн євро. Португалець минулого сезону провів 44 матчі у всіх турнірах і зробив 3 гольові передачі. Нагадаємо Мілан продовжує спроби підписати Тюрама.

newsArray.title: Laut Ranking: Hansi Flick ist bestbezahlter Nationaltrainer der Welt
newsArray.description: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten.
newsArray.content: Sein Gehalt kann sich sehen lassen: Trotz der zuletzt ausbleibenden Erfolge verdient Bundestrainer Hansi Flick mehr Geld als seine Konkurrenten. Hansi Flick ist mit etwa 6,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr der bestbezahlte Nationaltrainer der Welt. Das geht aus einer Liste mit den geschätzten Gehältern aller WM-Trainer des Jahres 2022 des französischen Portals "France Football" hervor. Nach Flick auf Rang eins folgen unter anderem Englands Gareth Southgate mit 5,8 Millionen Euro auf Platz zwei und Frankreichs Didier Deschamps (3,8 Millionen Euro) auf Platz drei. Der argentinische Weltmeistertrainer Lionel Scaloni ist mit 2,9 Millionen Euro dicht dahinter. Trainer, die erst nach der WM einen Nationalposten übernahmen oder wie etwa Italiens Roberto Mancini gar nicht an dem Turnier teilgenommen hatten, verdienen ebenfalls weniger als Flick. Löw verdiente offenbar deutlich weniger Aber warum kassiert der deutsche Bundestrainer überhaupt so viel Geld? Das Gehalt von Vorgänger Joachim Löw wurde nach "Bild"-Informationen auf 3 bis 3,5 Millionen Euro pro Jahr geschätzt. Da Flick aber zuvor beim FC Bayern coachte und mit seinem damaligen Team sechs Titel in einer Saison gewonnen hatte, war er wohl in einer guten Verhandlungsposition. Für ihn und sein Team gilt es nun, sich auf die Heim-Europameisterschaft im kommenden Jahr zu konzentrieren. Zuletzt konnte er nur vier von 16 Länderspielen gewinnen.

newsArray.title: Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed
creator: Peter Lynch
newsArray.description: Outgoing Everton defender has not agreed terms with Premier League rivals Fulham, according to Fabrizio Romano. The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per journalist Alan Nixon (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as ... The post Fabrizio Romano: 'Official proposal' made for Everton ace after Goodison exit confirmed appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Colombian is wanted by the Cottagers this summer upon the expiry of his Toffees contract next week, as per (25 June). Mina is set to leave Goodison Park after five years at the club, as confirmed by the (9 June). “Understand Yerry Mina has not agreed terms with Fulham despite reports – nothing done, race remains open for the centre-back as free agent,” Romano wrote on . “Told Besiktas made an official proposal; Lens, Granada and Bologna are also interested.” Mina is clearly well-liked by various clubs, with a battle for his services seemingly on the cards this summer. He played a key role in keeping Everton in the top flight last season, despite only really coming into the picture at the very end of the campaign under Sean Dyche. Mina does have a questionable injury record, but the Toffees have already lost Conor Coady since the end of the season, with the centre-back returning to parent club Wolves. Youngster Jarrad Branthwaite could play a central part under the manager next time out following his loan spell at PSV, but Dyche will definitely be delving into the transfer market in order to bolster his options at the back. Mina’s exit seemed very likely for quite some time, but not many people would have been predicting the 28-year-old to stay in England. He may have the chance to do just that at Fulham, but it remains to be seen where he will be playing his football in the upcoming campaign.
